00054 enum wxJSONType {
00055     wxJSONTYPE_INVALID = 0,  
00056     wxJSONTYPE_NULL,       
00057     wxJSONTYPE_INT,        
00058     wxJSONTYPE_UINT,       
00059     wxJSONTYPE_DOUBLE,     
00060     wxJSONTYPE_STRING,     
00061     wxJSONTYPE_CSTRING,    
00062     wxJSONTYPE_BOOL,       
00063     wxJSONTYPE_ARRAY,      
00064     wxJSONTYPE_OBJECT,     
00065     wxJSONTYPE_LONG,       
00066     wxJSONTYPE_INT64,      
00067     wxJSONTYPE_ULONG,      
00068     wxJSONTYPE_UINT64,     
00069     wxJSONTYPE_SHORT,      
00070     wxJSONTYPE_USHORT,     
00071     wxJSONTYPE_MEMORYBUFF  
00072 };
00073 
00074 // the comment position: every value only has one comment position
00075 // althrough comments may be splitted into several lines
00076 enum {
00077   wxJSONVALUE_COMMENT_DEFAULT = 0,
00078   wxJSONVALUE_COMMENT_BEFORE,
00079   wxJSONVALUE_COMMENT_AFTER,
00080   wxJSONVALUE_COMMENT_INLINE,
00081 };

00326 union wxJSONValueHolder  {
00327     int             m_valInt;
00328     unsigned int    m_valUInt;
00329     short int       m_valShort;
00330     unsigned short  m_valUShort;
00331     long int        m_valLong;
00332     unsigned long   m_valULong;
00333     double          m_valDouble;
00334     const wxChar*   m_valCString;
00335     bool            m_valBool;
00336 #if defined( wxJSON_64BIT_INT )
00337     wxInt64         m_valInt64;
00338     wxUint64        m_valUInt64;
00339 #endif
00340     };
00341 
00342 //
00343 // access to the (unsigned) integer value is done through
00344 // the VAL_INT macro which expands to the 'long' integer
00345 // data member of the 'long long' integer if 64-bits integer
00346 // support is enabled
00347 #if defined( wxJSON_64BIT_INT )
00348  #define VAL_INT  m_valInt64
00349  #define VAL_UINT m_valUInt64
00350 #else
00351  #define VAL_INT  m_valLong
00352  #define VAL_UINT m_valULong
00353 #endif
00354
